channel.title: How to contribute code changes on PrestaShop Developer Documentation
channel.description: Recent content in How to contribute code changes on PrestaShop Developer Documentation

item.title: Contribute using localhost
item.description: How to become a Core ContributorIf you’re reading this, thank you! This means you’re interested in contributing to PrestaShop. You probably are a PrestaShop developer, and your use of the project is slightly different from ours. For instance, there are few differences between a PrestaShop zip release package and the GitHub repository. This is because the release package is a build, whereas the GitHub repository contains the sources. To be able to contribute you need:

item.title: Contribute using Docker
item.description: How to become a Core Contributor using DockerIf you’re reading this, thank you! This means you’re interested in contributing to PrestaShop. You probably are a PrestaShop developer, and your use of the project is slightly different from ours. For instance, there are few differences between a PrestaShop zip release package and the GitHub repository. This is because the release package is a build, whereas the GitHub repository contains the sources.

item.title: How to push your changes to GitHub
item.description: How to publish your contribution to GitHubOnce your changes sound good and tests pass on your local computer, you can contribute to the open source project by submitting these changes as a Pull Request on GitHub. First you need to push your branch on GitHub: git push origin add-emoticons-support You will need to use your GitHub credentials. Now you can create your Pull Request on GitHub. If you don’t know how to do it, you can read GitHub documentation.

item.title: Adding a new Core hook
item.description: Adding a new Core hook If you wish to add a new hook but are not sure how to proceed, you can read the Adding a new Core hook guide. Contributing a new hook to PrestaShop is a geat way to extend the software’s capabilities, but it requires a few steps to be done properly that we called the “definition of ready”. So, before you start submitting a pull request, make sure you have completed the following steps.
